p: Furthermore, troponin elevation in critically ill patients is frequently due to Type II myocardial infarction unrelated to obstructive epicardial coronary artery disease. This protocol was able to identify those with critical anatomy that required invasive angiography and revascularization. Those who didn't have critical anatomy, the CCT was able to furnish additional information such as evaluation of the lung fields for COVID19 pneumonitis, myocarditis and pulmonary embolism all which could raise troponins and have been reported in COVID19 cases.
